document.docAuthor: Domahovski, Alexandre Cruz & Cavichioli, Rodney Ramiro
document.docTitle: Polana (Varpulana) grossii Domahovski & Cavichioli, 2017, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Six new Brazilian species of Polana (Varpulana) (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Gyponini) with key to males

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Six new Brazilian species of Polana (Varpulana) (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Gyponini) with key to males

subSubSection.paragraph: Description (male). Length ( holotype ) 6.6mm , female, ( paratype ) 7.7mm (n=4). Head ( Fig. 16 ) in dorsal view with median length approximately three-tenths interocular width; in lateral view ( Fig. 18 ), anterior margin slightly upturned. Other characteristics as in generic description.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 4–15.
P. (F.) bahiensis
sp. nov.
, holotype male. 4, head and thorax, dorsal view. 5, head, frontal view. 6, head and thorax, lateral view. 7, forewing. 8–15, male terminalia: 8, sternite VIII, ventral view. 9, pygofer, valve and subgenital plate, lateral view. 10, apex of pygofer, ventral view. 11, subgenital plate, ventral view. 12, style and connective, dorsal view. 13, style, lateral view. 14, aedeagus, lateral view. 15, aedeagus posterior view. Scale bars: 4–6 = 1.0 mm, 7 = 2.0 mm, 8–9 = 0.5 mm, 9–14 = 0.25 mm.

FIGURES 16–27.
P. (F.) grossii
sp. nov.
, holotype male. 16, head and thorax, dorsal view. 17, head, frontal view. 18, head and thorax, lateral view. 19, forewing. 20–27, male terminalia: 20, sternite VIII, ventral view. 21, pygofer, valve and subgenital plate, lateral view. 22, apex of pygofer, ventral view. 23, subgenital plate, ventral view. 24, style and connective, dorsal view. 25, style, lateral view. 26, aedeagus, lateral view. 27, aedeagus posterior view. Scale bars: 16–18 = 1.0 mm, 19 = 2.0 mm, 20–2 1 = 0.5 mm, 22–27 = 0.25 mm.

FIGURES 28–31.
P.
(F.) grossii
sp. nov.
, female paratype terminalia: 28, sternite VII and pygofer, ventral view. 29, pygofer and valvulae, lateral view. 30, first valvifer and first valvulae, lateral view. 31, second valvulae, lateral view. Scale bars: 28 = 1.0 mm, 29–31 = 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The new species name is in honor of dear friend Prof. Dr. Paschoal Coelho Grossi, a Brazilian coleopterologist who collects exceptional material and contributes to the study of several other groups.

Material examined. Holotype male:

Remarks.
Polana (V.) grossii
sp. nov.
is most similar to
P. (V.) alata
in the male pygofer lacking a protrusion on the posterior margin, having the atrial processes wide and shell-like, and the aedeagal shaft with two pairs of processes at mid-length of shaft; and in the shape of sternite VII of the female, with posterior margin slightly sinuous. However, in the new species the atrial processes are narrower than in
P. (V.) alata
and the processes at the mid-length of the shaft do not have bifid apices.
